page.title: 07FARMING IN FAWKHAM
page.content: Arable farming and woodland dominate the valley.Almost every squre of the "grid" includes cereal crops, wheat, barley and oats.Paddocks, grassland and rough pastures are considerable but livestock limited to a few cows,sheep, pigs,horses and donkeys.Most fields are boarded by hedgerows some of them extremly old.Large areas of woodland are made up of sweet chestnut,elder, beech, hazel, hawthorn,and many decidous trees.Only one fruit farm noted.There is an excellent horti- cultural nursery.Mussenden Farm,Canada Farm,Scudders Farm,Gorse Hill Farm, Speedgate Farm,White House Farm,Gaydawn Farm,Pennis Farm,Court Lodge Farm, Hill Barn Farm lend picturesque and historic background to the valley.
